title: Bookly
subtitle: A 'books and authors' CRUD app. Track your favorite authors, then track their books! Amazing!
description: I intentionally kept the design of this app simple so I could focus on learning the HapiJS ecosystem, and building a robust REST API therein.
I also used this as an opportunity to learn how to set up an Ubuntu/Nginx server on Digital Ocean, so that is where the API is being served from.

Front end built with [Quasar](https://github.com/quasarframework/quasar) (Vue) and deployed via Netlify, back end built with [HapiJS](https://github.com/hapijs/hapi) (Node) and deployed on Nginx/Ubuntu on Digital Ocean. For more details, check out the demo and/or repos below!

title: Snippets
subtitle: A 'save it for later' bookmarking app, similar to Pocket or Google Keep.
description: I have used Pocket and Keep off and on for a few years, and while I like them both, I also have many complaints about both of them. So I built my own version that includes only the features I like without any of the extra junk I don't like (e.g. ads injected into my data--_looking at you, Pocket_).

Front end built with [Vue](https://github.com/vuejs/vue) + [Element](https://github.com/ElemeFE/element) and deployed via Netlify, back end built with [Django REST Framework](https://github.com/encode/django-rest-framework) and deployed on Heroku. For more details, check out the demo and/or repos below!
**Note**: The API is deployed on a free Heroku dyno, so if it takes a few seconds to spin up, don't panic! Everything is going to be okay, I promise!

title: GameOn
subtitle: An app to tracking gaming habits.
description: A fairly simple app to allow you to track your gaming habits. I have a strong, very non-scientific fixation with seeing what games I was playing when, and for how many days, so I built this app to let me do just that.

Front end built with [Quasar](https://github.com/quasarframework/quasar) (Vue) and deployed via Netlify, back end built with [Django REST Framework](https://github.com/encode/django-rest-framework) and deployed on Heroku. For more details, check out the demo and/or repos below!
**Note**: The API is deployed on a free Heroku dyno, so if it takes a few seconds to spin up, don't panic! Everything is going to be okay, I promise!

title: Space Junk [Game]
subtitle: A puzzle-action-matching game set in space! What's not to love?
description: This was the last game We Did It Games made before we came to the unspoken conclusion that we didn't really have time to work on games anymore. The design was kept extremely minimal for these reasons, but it still turned out to be a pretty fun game.

The final game was built with Unity 5 (C#), and the original prototype was made in GameMaker. It only took us a month or two total to put all of this together--remember, kids: keep your projects realistically small, and you might actually finish them!
Watch the majestic launch trailer [here](https://youtu.be/c6pNwtvO1ME)! Then follow the link below to download your own copy!
